metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1736 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Turning off RDP Remote Desktop Sharing with gnome-control-center would only turn off RDP sharing for the current session. Upon logging back in, RDP Sharing would be enabled again without any additional user interaction or notification.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1736` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-control-center - 1:41.4-1ubuntu13.2
gnome-control-center-data - 1:41.4-1ubuntu13.2
gnome-control-center-faces - 1:41.4-1ubuntu13.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This issue is caused by Ubuntu's configuration which results in gnome-remote-desktop's systemd service always running. That issue will be also fixed in a future SRU.

criterions.comment: gnome-control-center package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:41.4-1ubuntu13.2').
